refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "buttons" GtkButtonsType : Write / Construct Only "message-type" GtkMessageType : Read / Write / Construct

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkMessageDialog presents a dialog with an image representing the type of message (Error, Question, etc.) alongside some message text. It's simply a convenience widget; you could construct the equivalent of GtkMessageDialog from GtkDialog without too much effort, but GtkMessageDialog saves typing.

refsect2.title: enum GtkMessageType
refsect2.para: The type of message being displayed in the dialog.

refsect2.title: enum GtkButtonsType
refsect2.para: Prebuilt sets of buttons for the dialog. If none of these choices are appropriate, simply use GTK_BUTTONS_NONE then call gtk_dialog_add_buttons().

refsect2.title: gtk_message_dialog_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gtk_message_dialog_new (GtkWindow *parent, GtkDialogFlags flags, GtkMessageType type, GtkButtonsType buttons, const gchar *message_format, ...);
refsect2.para: Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with an icon indicating the dialog type (error, warning, etc.) and some text the user may want to see. When the user clicks a button a "response" signal is emitted with response IDs from GtkResponseType. See GtkDialog for more details.

listitem.simpara: transient parent, or NULL for none

refsect2.title: gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkWidget* gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup (GtkWindow *parent, GtkDialogFlags flags, GtkMessageType type, GtkButtonsType buttons, const gchar *message_format, ...);
refsect2.para: Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with an icon indicating the dialog type (error, warning, etc.) and some text which is marked up with the Pango text markup language. When the user clicks a button a "response" signal is emitted with response IDs from GtkResponseType. See GtkDialog for more details.

Special XML characters in the printf() arguments passed to this function will automatically be escaped as necessary. (See g_markup_printf_escaped() for how this is implemented.) Usually this is what you want, but if you have an existing Pango markup string that you want to use literally as the label, then you need to use gtk_message_dialog_set_markup() instead, since you can't pass the markup string either as the format (it might contain '%' characters) or as a string argument.

listitem.simpara: transient parent, or NULL for none

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_message_dialog_set_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets the text of the message dialog to be str, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets the secondary text of the message dialog to be message_format (with printf()-style).
Note that setting a secondary text makes the primary text become bold, unless you have provided explicit markup.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets the secondary text of the message dialog to be message_format (with printf()-style), which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Note that setting a secondary text makes the primary text become bold, unless you have provided explicit markup.

Due to an oversight, this function does not escape special XML characters like gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup() does. Thus, if the arguments may contain special XML characters, you should use g_markup_printf_escaped() to escape it.

listitem.simpara: printf()-style markup string (see Pango markup format), or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "buttons" property
refsect2.para: The buttons shown in the message dialog.
Default value: GTK_BUTTONS_NONE

refsect2.title: The "message-type" property
refsect2.para: The type of message.
Default value: GTK_MESSAGE_INFO

refsect2.title: The "message-border" style property
refsect2.para: Width of border around the label and image in the message dialog.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 12

refsect2.title: The "use-separator" style property
refsect2.para: Whether to put a separator between the message dialog's text and the buttons.
Default value: FALSE
